basedOn.display: MR BRACHIAL PLEXUS RIGHT WITHOUT AND WITH IV CONTRAST

valueString:
EXAM:  MR BRACHIAL PLEXUS RIGHT WITHOUT AND WITH IV CONTRAST


COMPARISON: Multiple MRIs including the multiple cartilage brachial plexus dating back to 2/23/2015. Left brachial plexus MRI without and with IV contrast 4/23/2024 and cervical spine MRI without and with IV contrast 4/24/2024


FINDINGS:  Multilevel T2 hyperintense extraspinal neurogenic lesions presumably representing schwannomas given history of schwannomatosis. These measure approximately 1 cm in greatest dimension involving the C3-C7 and T3-T4. The largest lesions involve 
the C8 nerve root measuring approximately 2.2 cm in oblique AP dimension and the T1 nerve root measuring approximately 3.3 cm in oblique AP dimension.


Focal 1.1 cm presumed schwannoma involving the superior trunk of the brachial plexus (series 6 image 28 and series 4, image 26).


These lesions have not significantly changed in size since 2/23/2015. No focal abnormal enhancement. There is no perilesional edema or infiltration.


Multiple additional schwannomas involving the left-sided cervical nerves (at least involving C3-T3) and brachial plexus seen on the edge of film and localizer sequences.


Moderate acromioclavicular joint arthrosis.
